1: Selection sort is a simple comparison-based sorting algorithm. It repeatedly finds the smallest (or largest) element from an unsorted portion of the list and swaps it with the first unsorted element.
2: Bubble Sort repeatedly compares and swaps adjacent elements in a list, pushing the largest numbers to the end with each pass. It continues until the entire list is sorted.
3: Insertion sort is a simple sorting algorithm that works by iteratively inserting each element of an unsorted list into its correct position in a sorted portion of the list.
